file_name: SmartRxSystemsInc_20180914_1-A_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_11351705_EX1A-6 MAT CTRCT_Distributor Agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text:
15.
CONTROLLING LAW:
15.1 Generally. This Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively governed, construed, enforced and controlled by the laws of the United
States of America and of the State of Texas. The parties agree that any controversy, claim, dispute, or disagreement arising under, out of, or relating
to this Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively submitted for resolution exclusively to courts of competent jurisdiction located in the County of
Orange, State of Florida, USA. Distributor consents and submits to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the resolution of such
controversies, claims, disputes, or disagreements.
perturbation.changed_text:
15.
CONTROLLING LAW:
15.1 Generally. This Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively governed, construed, enforced and controlled by the laws of the United
States of America and of the State of Texas. The parties agree that any controversy, claim, dispute, or disagreement arising under, out of, or relating
to this Distributor Agreement shall be exclusively submitted for resolution exclusively to courts of competent jurisdiction located in the County of
Tyler, State of Texas, USA. Distributor consents and submits to the exclusive jurisdiction and venue of such courts for the resolution of such
controversies, claims, disputes, or disagreements.
perturbation.explanation: Section 15.1 originally stated that disputes would be resolved in Orange County, Florida. By changing the location to Tyler, Texas, it directly contradicts the original venue selection and creates uncertainty about which jurisdiction governs dispute resolution. This contradiction could lead to legal challenges regarding where lawsuits should be filed and which state's laws should be applied.
